phrase.cizu_name: beat (或 smash) someone to a pulp

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the soft fleshy part of fruit): from Latin pulpa. The verb dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: If an object is pressed into a pulp, it is crushed or beaten until it is soft, smooth, and wet.

example.ex: The olives are crushed to a pulp by stone rollers.

entry.def: In fruit or vegetables, the pulp is the soft part inside the skin.

example.ex: Make maximum use of the whole fruit, including the pulp which is high in fibre.
example.tran: 水果的各个部分都要最大限度地利用，包括富含纤维的果肉。

entry.def: Wood pulp is material made from crushed wood. It is used to make paper.

entry.tran: （故事或小说）粗制滥造的，庸俗刺激的，耸人听闻的
entry.def: People refer to stories or novels as pulp fiction when they consider them to be of poor quality and intentionally shocking or sensational.

entry.tran: 把（纸张、蔬菜或水果）打成浆
entry.def: If paper, vegetables, or fruit are pulped, they are crushed into a smooth, wet paste.

example.ex: Onions can be boiled and pulped to a puree.
example.tran: 洋葱可以煮一下打成糊。
奶油状或浆状的西红柿

entry.def: If money or documents are pulped, they are destroyed. This is done to stop the money being used or to stop the documents being seen by the public.

example.ex: 25 million pounds worth of five pound notes have been pulped because the designers made a mistake.
example.tran: 因为设计者们犯了一个错误，致使价值2,500万英镑的5英镑纸钞被化成纸浆。

entry.tran: 把…打得稀巴烂；把…打成重伤
entry.def: If someone is beaten to a pulp or beaten to pulp, they are hit repeatedly until they are very badly injured.

example.ex: I tried to talk myself out of a fight and got beaten to a pulp instead by three other boys.
example.tran: 我尽量克制住自己不要打架，却被另外3个男孩打成了重伤。
